page.title: 15HOUSING IN WYDDIAL
page.content: Housing varies greatly. Wyddial Hall is a minor stately home. Wyddial Park, Wyddial Parva, the Coach House,the Bury, Beauchamps and Rectory are all substantial houses. At the other end of the scale in the village are six tiny terraced cattages, built as tied cottages about 1900 and only partly modernised. There are four houses of the 1950s and a great variety of bungalows and small houses of the 1920s and 1930s. None have main drainage but all have access to mains water and electricity. Calor gas, oil and solid fuel may also be used for heating. Planning for new houses is difficult to obtain. More commonly houses are enlarged by extensions,two or more small cottages are turned into one or redundant buildings are turned into houses. As tied farm cottages become empty they are usually sold.
